channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report I-2024070039
item.description:
Report I-2024070039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: San Francisco
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Halfway through the flight, passenger 20A, HOLUB/ALEXEIDAVID, told FA Pang that their laptop was emitting an electrical smell. FA conferred with FM and both agreed there was a smell. No flames, heat, or smoke were present. Out of an abundance of caution, the MacBook Pro was placed into the TCB. The TCB was placed in an aft Iav and monitored occasionally per CA instructions occasionally throughout the flight. The TCB remained in the aft Iav until descent, in which it was brought to the forward Iav for easy access upon door opening. Due to no signs of fire, smoke, or heat, pax was escorted to the exit and was able to retrieve the laptop out of the TCB. FAs reminded to fill out IORs and thanked for erring on the side of caution. Name: Alex Eidavid Holub Address: 36 Mayflower Drive Wenham MA 01984 Phone: 626-676-1736 Email: alexholub@gmail.com

item.title: Report X-2024070319
item.description:
Report X-2024070319

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package is an RTS from station 814. The exterior packaging had no orientation arrows, and no limited quantity diamond label on the FedEx repack box. The box is wet and hardened on the underside. Inside, a lot of paper filling materials were used. A clear plastic hazmat waste bag was used to contain the inner box that the shipment originally came with. The bag was secured haphazardly with a bunch of tape. The original outer box is wet all over and a diamond cut mark can be seen. The place where the limited quantity label used to be. This can be verified from the spidr image of the original package when it was picked up. Reviewing the DPR of the package, the package was not flagged as a dangerous goods, when in fact, 3 items of 2 different limited quantity was found. The original contents were 2 qty of 1 gallon metal container of Clear Guard EF, 1 metal can of Solvent Thinner, 1 qty 8 oz plastic container of Copper C Metal Coating, 1 qty of 8 oz Gold C Metal Coating, and 20fl oz high volume low pressure gravity feed spray gun. All items are products of Sculpt Nouveau. 1 container of Clear Guard EF was dented and the plastic seal for the lid came off and spill 3/4 of its contents. The Solvent Thinner was also dented and spilled from the cap around half of its content. The other gallon of Clear Guard EF was wet but salvageable, so are the metal coating, the content of the spray gun can be salvaged but the packaging is ruined. The package did not get a DG Nav Dangerous Goods Report when it was initially discovered but instead removed the Limited quantity diamond label and flagged the package non-hazardous and then RTS the package completely, including the damaged LQ.

item.title: Report E-2024070094
item.description:
Report E-2024070094

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 25, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to remediate the impacted site. GMES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, debris, and damaged pails were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: Package came out of trailer 806028 in a wet state, package was placed in a tote for QA inspection, upon analysis, contents is a bottle of sink and surface cleaner sanitizer that had a loose cap from movement, which cause its liquid content to spill out. A secure cap or better packing inside will help prevent cap from getting loose.

item.description:

  • City: OCEANSIDE

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging is wet and torn on the underside of the box. Opened the box from the top and what was on the top side of the box is the underside of the bottles. These bottles are 2 qty of 2.5 gallon white plastic bottles of Noble Chemical Breaker 1, Liquid Soil Breaker. With the cap side at the bottom of the box, in reference to the orientation arrow of the box, the pressure of the weight led the liquid to spill with both bottles losing approximately 8 fl oz each.

item.title: Report E-2024070055
item.description:
Report E-2024070055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that there was a release of UN2735 Rez-Cure EP 243 Part B "Rez-Cure EP 243 Part B" from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum impacting the trailer floor and concrete underneath the trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and dispatched Clean Harbors to assist with cleanup. Clean harbors arrived onsite and deployed oil dri to the impacted areas. The damaged drum was overpacked into a 85-gallon poly drum and the impacted oil dri was containerized into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum for disposal.

  • Description: It was reported that 1-gallon of SDA 40B 200 Proof was released from one (1) 55-gallon drum impacting the concrete dock floor. The drum was punctured by a forklift at UOA. ERTS reviewed the SDS for the product with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE.

item.title: Report E-2024070000
item.description:
Report E-2024070000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was punctured by fallen freight and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, neutralizers, granular absorbents and absorbent pads to the UN3265-impacted trailer floor, wooden slab, tote exterior and swept them up. AS deconstructed the wooden slab and conducted a gravity tote transfer into a new 330-gallon poly tote. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum. The original tote was deconstructed with and collected into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.
